question: I would like to know if buying house thru Guidance Financial Group of Falls Church, VA, USA is OK. Their sharia board has Mufti Taqi Usmani as an advisor.
answer:
QUESTION
This the reply they gave to my questions: Our Declining Balance Co-Ownership Program has been carefully designed to meet your needs. Under the terms of our Co-Ownership Program, you do not repay an interest-bearing loan. Instead, you become a co-owner with an investor, from whom you acquire full ownership through affordable monthly payments. The money used to fund the purchase or refinance is our own. However, after we make the purchase, FreddieMac then becomes Co-owner in the program with the homebuyer. FreddieMac is not a lender, nor do they charge interest. They invest in home finance products. Their interest-based investments are not mixed with our business. The website is www.guidancefinancialgroup.com
ANSWER


Share:
We had looked into this scheme some time ago, and according to the information available to us, this scheme involves Riba (usury). It is hence not permissible to finance one's house through such a scheme. %0D%0A%0D%0ANote: Before arriving at the above answer, various attempts were made to contact Guidance Financial and get input from their side. %0D%0A%0D%0AMany months ago, we received a query similar to yours. We requested the brother to obtain all available documentation in regards as to how the scheme operates, and what the terms of the contract were. %0D%0A%0D%0AAfter studying the documents, we picked up a number of issues which were clearly non-Shari'ah compliant. We then prepared a questionnaire, which was sent via email to the company on 15 August 2002. This was then followed up by a number of reminders, which did not yield any results. %0D%0A%0D%0AWe then pursued this with a fax dated 17 September 2002. We finally man! aged to elicit a response. The spokesman of Guidance Financial, Mr. Ahmed Attia, acknowledged receipt of our initial email, and said that the matter was under consideration. He explained that he had forwarded our queries to his Shari'ah Board, and that we could expect a reply by early October 2002. %0D%0A%0D%0AOctober came and went, and yet there was no reply. We then followed this up with an email sent on 5 December 2002. In this email we stated that should no answers to our questions be forthcoming within 15 days, we will have to make a decision based on whatever documentation we have available with us. Still too there was no response. %0D%0A%0D%0ATo date (2003-01-24) we have not received a reply to our queries. %0D%0A%0D%0AGuidance Financial claims to have an independent Shari'ah Board who have researched and approved their scheme. It thus implies that this Board ought to have done its homework well before the scheme was offered to the public. If this was the case, we find it difficu! lt to understand why more than five months are required to give answers to issues that, it would be expected, were deliberated and resolved before the public offering of this financial product was made. %0D%0A%0D%0AThe non-co-operation of the company itself raises questions regarding its integrity.%0D%0A%0D%0Aand Allah Ta'ala Knows Best%0D%0A%0D%0AMl. Imraan Vawda%0D%0AFATWA DEPT.%0D%0A%0D%0ACHECKED AND APPROVED: Mufti Ebrahim Desai
